item.description: Deep Learning Projects ByteNet - Tensorflow Implemented the dilated convolutional ByteNet model of neural machine translation from the paper Neural Machine Translation in Linear Time . Text To Image Synthesis Using Thought Vectors Generative Adversarial Text to Image Synthesis using skip-thought vectors. Implemented the GAN-CLS algorithm from the paper Generative Adversarial Text to Image Synthesis and conditioned the model using text-embeddings from Skip Thought Vectors. Caption Generated Images the flower shown has yellow anther red pistil and bright red petals this flower has petals that are yellow, white and purple and has dark lines the petals on this flower are white with a yellow center this flower has a lot of small round pink petals.

item.title: The Important Things In Life Are Often Simple
item.description: I remember these words from a lecture on Theory of Computation. The more you complicate a solution, the more specific it becomes to the problem being solved. The less you assume, the more you generalize. I’ll keep this article specific to Machine Learning and how simple things can do wonders! Language There is something magical about how a little child learns a language. The child is not imparted any knowledge related to the semantics or the grammar of the language.

I am a passionate coder, currently pursuing my Bachelors degree in Computer Science from IIT Roorkee. I love solving real world problems. The journeys towards the solutions have been more exciting than the destinations themselves. I have been recently working on developing RTIFeed, a web platform to make authentic information available to the masses. This project has kept our team inspired and motivated for the last one year. I can talk endlessly about this project and its potential, but this page is about me!

item.title: Lift Your Heart
item.description: The road was misty, dull and dark, No one was there to lift my heart. I’m all alone in that scary way, The road less travelled is what they say. Was I too brave to take a try? On the road less travelled by. Was I too strong to face the rocks? I want a chance to turn the clocks. If the choice was wrong, you make it right,

item.title: Step Aside From The Race
item.description: This is one of my first poems and my personal favourite. Step aside from the race to think. Relax and realize the purpose of the race Think from an unconditioned perspective Are we here to survive? Why are we so desperate to keep the world moving? Are we merely players in The Big Drama? Being watched by an unknown audience And we humans playing the role of fools and jokers
